description: Two bears are shown on a cliff edge, one actively chewing through the rope of a human climber dangling below. This presents an absurd scenario where predators use calculated sabotage rather than direct attack to secure prey. The situation is a dark inversion of typical climbing dangers, implying a level of premeditation and planning in the bears' hunting strategy. The act of deliberately cutting the rope with teeth introduces a surreal method for bears to acquire food. This highlights the unexpected and darkly humorous nature of the encounter.
caption: "We'll be eating in tonight."
